Description: Rim Sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; trace of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: 'z' frieze between dilute lines at rim; below, sphinx (head remaining) to left; dotted cross rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Although Lemos does not specifically mention this sherd, the parallels found in the subject matter and execution indicate that it ought to belong to her Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 981). For parallels with other vessels, see British Museum 1924,1201.264, 1924,1201.255 and 1924,1201.259 which may be by the same painter.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0588) (phase 2)
